benchmark_details.name: Alpha Excel Benchmark
benchmark_details.overview: This study presents a novel benchmark for evaluating Large Language Models (LLMs) using challenges derived from the Financial Modeling World Cup (FMWC) Excel competitions. The benchmark provides a standardized framework for assessing LLM capabilities in realistic business-oriented tasks.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To create a practical evaluation framework for measuring Large Language Models' capabilities on business-relevant tasks.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The benchmark's translation from interactive spreadsheet challenges to text-based evaluations sacrifices elements of the original task environment.

data.source: Challenges derived from historical FMWC competitions.
data.annotation: Challenges transformed into standardized JSON format for programmatic evaluation.

methodology.calculation: Models are scored based on the quality of their solutions with partial credit for multi-step problems.
methodology.interpretation: The scoring system allocates points according to solution quality, reflecting correctness in multi-step problems.
methodology.baseline_results: GPT-4o-mini demonstrated the highest overall performance.
methodology.validation: The evaluation system maintains consistent environmental conditions across evaluations.
